law.fulltitle:
An Act to repeal the Act approved August 17, 1920, entitled, An Act to establish the fee system now existing in the Superior Court of the Albany Judicial Circuit, as applied to the office of the Solicitor-General on all fees now, heretofore or hereafter accruing to the office of Solicitor-General in said Circuit, in so far as the same constitutes the compensation attached to said office; to provide for the payment of a salary to said Solicitor-General, in addition to the salary prescribed in Paragraph 1 of Section 13 of Article 6 of the Constitution of this State. To provide for the disposition of the fines, forfeitures and fees, including insolvent costs, accruing to the office of Solicitor-General in said Judicial Circuit; to impose certain duties upon the Clerks of the Superior Courts of the counties composing said Circuit, in reference to the collection, payment and disposition of all funds, moneys and emoluments accruing to the office of Solicitor-General; to provide for the levy and collection of a tax by the county authorities of
the various counties composing said Circuit, for the purpose of paying the salary of said Solicitor-General and for other purposes.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same, That an Act entitled An Act to establish the fee system now existing in the Superior Court of the Albany Judicial Circuit, as applied to the office of the Solicitor-General and all fees now, heretofore or hereafter, accruing to the office of Solicitor-General in said Circuit, in so far as the same constitutes the compensation attached to said office; to provide for the payment of a salary to said Solicitor-General, in addition to the salary prescribed in Paragraph 1 of Section 13 of Article 6 of the Constitution of this State. To provide for the disposition of the fines, forfeitures and fees, including insolvent costs, accruing to the office of Solicitor-General in said Judicial Circuit; to impose certain duties upon the Clerks of the Superior Courts of the counties composing said Circuit, in reference to the collection, payment and disposition of all funds, moneys and emoluments accruing to the office of Solicitor-General; to provide for the levy and collection of a tax by the county authorities of the various counties composing said Circuit, for the purpose of paying the salary of said Solicitor-General, and for other purposes, approved August 17, 1920 (Acts, 1920, pages 419, 420, 421, 422, and 423), be, and the same is, hereby repealed. Act of 1920 repealed.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That this Act shall go into effect September 1, 1921. Effective September 1, 1921.
Sec. 3. All laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.shorttitle: ATLANTIC CIRCUIT; PAYMENT BY EFFINGHAM COUNTY.
law.fulltitle: An Act to amend an Act putting the Solicitor-General of the Atlantic Circuit on a salary under the Acts of 1919, being Bill No. 249, on Page 541 and Section two on Page 542 by striking the words, Effingham County shall pay the sum of $250.00 from line 12, in said Act.
law.p: Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same:

Section 1. That the words Effingham County shall pay the sum of $250.00 in line twelve on page five forty-two, Section two of an Act putting the Solicitor-General of the Atlantic Circuit on a salary, be, and the same are, hereby stricken from said Act. Payment discontinued.
Sec. 2. All laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act are hereby repealed.

law.shorttitle: ATLANTIC CIRCUIT; PAYMENT BY LONG COUNTY.
law.fulltitle:
An Act to amend an Act entitled An Act to abolish the fee system now existing in the Superior Courts of the Atlantic Judicial Circuit, as applied to the office of Solicitor-General, and all fees hereinafter accruing to the office of Solicitor-General, in said Circuit, in so far as the same constitutes the compensation attached to said office; to provide for the payment of the salary of said Solicitor-General in addition to the salary prescribed in Paragraph one, Section 13,
of Article (6) of the Constitution of this State; to provide for the disposition of the fines, forfeitures and fees, including insolvent costs, accruing to the office of Solicitor-General in said Judicial Circuit; to impose certain duties upon the Clerk of the Superior Courts of the counties composing said Circuits and upon the Solicitor-General of said Circuit in reference to the collection, payment and disposition of all funds, moneys, and emoluments accruing to the office of Solicitor-General; to provide for the levy and collection of a tax by the county authorities of the various counties composing said Circuit for the purpose of paying the salary of said Solicitor-General, and for other purposes; said Act having been passed by the Legislature of Georgia at the 1919 session and approved by the Governor of Georgia on the 18th day of August, 1919.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same, That Section 2 of an Act approved August 18, 1919, entitled An Act to abolish the fee system now existing in the Superior Courts of the Atlantic Judicial Circuit as applied to the office of Solicitor-General, in said Circuit, and for other purposes, be amended by striking the words and figures, Effingham County shall pay the sum of $250.00 and inserting in lieu thereof the words and figures, Long County shall pay the sum of $250.00, wherever the same shall appear in said Section 2 of said Act. Payment to be made.
Sec.2. Be it further enacted, That this Act shall become effective immediately upon its passage. Effective on approval.
Sec. 3. Be it further enacted, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to amend an Act approved August 20, 1918, entitled An Act to abolish the fee system now existing in the Superior Courts of the Blue Ridge Judicial Circuit, as applied to the office of Solicitor-General, and all fees now, heretofore or hereafter accruing to the office of Solicitor-General in said Circuit, in so far as the same constitutes the compensation attached to said office; to provide for the payment of a salary to said Solicitor-General in addition to the salary prescribed in Paragraph 1 of Section 13 of Article 6 of the Constitution of this State; to provide for the disposition of the fines, forfeitures and fees, including insolvent costs, accruing to the office of Solicitor-General in said Judicial Circuit; to impose certain duties upon the Clerks of the Superior Courts of the counties composing said Circuit, and upon the Solicitor-General of said Circuit in reference to the collection, payment and disposition of all funds, moneys and emoluments accruing to the office of Solicitor-General; to provide for the levy and collection of a tax by the county authorities of the various counties composing said Circuit, for the purpose of paying the salary of said Solicitor-General; and for other purposes, by striking from the second and thirty-third lines of Section 2 of said Act the figures $3,500.00 and inserting in lieu thereof the figures, $4,250.00, so as to increase the salary of the Solicitor-General of said Circuit to $4,250.00 per annum, in addition to the salary of two hundred and fifty ($250.00) dollars prescribed in Paragraph 1, Section 13, of Article 6 of the Constitution of this State, and the compensation provided in Section 5 of said Act.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same, That Section 2 of an Act approved August 20, 1918, pages 360, 361, 362, 363 and 364 of Georgia Laws of 1918, and the same is, hereby amended as follows: By striking the figures $3,000.00 in the second line of said section and inserting in lieu thereof the figures, $4,250.00 and by striking the figures $3,500.00 in the thirty-third line of said section of said Act, and inserting in lieu thereof the figures $4,250.00, so as to make the salary of the Solicitor-General of the Blue Ridge Judicial Circuit the sum of $4,250.00 per annum in addition to the constitutional salary of $250.00, as designated in said Act, and the compensation provided in Section 5 of said Act, Said salary of $4,250.00 and the constitutional salary of two hundred and fifty dollars, shall be in full payment for all services of said Solicitor-General, for all traveling and other expenses and for all sums paid out by said Solicitor-General for clerical aid and legal assistants engaged or employed by him, except as provided by law to Solicitors-General. Act of 1918 amended. Compensation.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle:
An Act to amend an Act creating the Ogeechee Circuit, being No. 45, on Page 110, of the Acts of 1919, and amending Section No. 4, of said Act on Page 111, of said Acts of 1919, by striking from said Act and Section four the following words, to-wit: Provided,
however, that the Solicitors-General serving in the counties composing Ogeechee Circuit at this time may continue to serve said counties until their present term of office in said counties shall expire.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same, That from and after the passage of this Act, that the Act creating the Ogeechee Circuit as contained in the Acts of 1919, on Pages 110 and 111, Section four, beginning in line eight of said Section four at the word Provided and running through lines nine, ten, eleven and part of line twelve, inclusive of the word expire, be amended by striking from said Act the following words or language contained in said Act, to-wit: Provided, however, that the Solicitors-General serving in the counties composing Ogeechee Circuit at this time may continue to serve said counties until their present term of office in said counties shall expire. Provided, further, that the Solicitor-General of the Ogeechee Circuit now elected and qualified shall serve said Circuit in all the counties composing said Circuit as provided by law. Act of 1919 amended. County solicitors. Solicitor-general of circuit.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to repeal an Act to authorize the Ordinary of Bacon County, Georgia, to collect special tax from all persons residing in said County subject to road duty under the general law of said State, approved August 18, 1917, and for other purposes.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, That from and after the passage of this Act, an Act of the General Assembly, approved August 18, 1917, entitled, An Act to authorize the Ordinary of Bacon County, Georgia, to collect a special tax from all persons residing in said County subject to road duty, under the general law of said State, and for other purposes, be, and the same is, hereby repealed. Act of 1917 repealed.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act, be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to amend an Act, approved December 22, 1898, providing for the election of Board of County Commissioners, by the people of Baldwin County, Georgia.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same, That the Act approved December 22, 1898, providing for the election of the County Commissioners of Baldwin County, Georgia, by the people of said County, be amended by striking therefrom all of Section 1 and Section 3 of said Act. Act of 1898, 1 and 3 stricken.

Sec. 2. Be it further enacted, That in lieu of Section 1 of said Act, the following be substituted, to-wit: That from and after the passage of this Act the election of said Commissioners of Roads and Revenues of Baldwin County shall be by direct vote of the people. At the next General Election three Commissioners of Roads and Revenues shall be elected. The person receiving the highest vote at said general election shall be commissioned and hold his office for the full term of six years, beginning January 1, 1923. The person receiving the next highest number of votes at said general election shall be commissioned and hold his office for four years, beginning January 1, 1923, and the person receiving
the next highest number of votes at said general election shall hold his office and be commissioned for the full term of two years from January 1, 1923. Election by direct vote.

Sec. 3. Be it further enacted, That thereafter at every general election, there shall be elected one member of said Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues, who shall be commissioned and hold his office for the full term of six years, beginning January 1st, after the date of the general election, at which he shall have been elected. Six year term.

Sec. 4. Be it further enacted, That the person receiving the highest number of votes cast at the general election to be held in 1922 shall be Chairman of said Board, and perform all the duties incident to said office. Chairman.

Sec. 5. Be it further enacted, That said Commissioners of Roads and Revenues shall give a bond in the sum of Five Thousand Dollars each, payable to the Ordinary of said County, with good and sufficient security, to be approved by the Ordinary of said County, for the faithful discharge of their duties as such Commissioners of Roads and Revenues. The surety on said bonds shall be some surety company, engaged in the business of writing bonds of said character, and the annual premium thereon shall be paid out of the County funds, and said Commissioners are hereby authorized and empowered to draw their warrant upon the Treasurer of said County for the payment of said premiums. Bond.
Sec. 6. Be it further enacted, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act, be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to abolish an Act approved August 9th, 1920, entitled An Act to amend an Act approved August 17th, 1917, Acts of 1917, pages 312 and 313, entitled `Banks County Commutation Road Tax,' the manner of collecting same, and for other purposes.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same, That the above Act described in the caption, be, and the same is, hereby repealed. Act of 1920 repealed.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act, be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to repeal an Act providing for the creation of a Board of Commissioners for the County of Bulloch, providing that the same shall consist of one member; to provide when this Act shall go into effect, and for other purposes; the Act sought to be repealed to be found in the Georgia Laws of 1920, page 461, which was approved August 16, 1920.
law.p:
Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same, That from and after the passage and going into effect of this Act, that an Act to provide for the creation of a Commissioner for the County of Bulloch; to provide that the same shall consist of one
member; to prescribe his powers and duties; and to fix the compensation and manner of his selection and qualification, and for other purposes, Georgia Laws of 1920, page 461, and all Acts amendatory thereof, be and the same are, hereby repealed, provided, however, this Act shall not become operative and go into effect until January 1, 1922. Act of 1920 repealed. Effective January 1, 1922.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act, be and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to provide for the creation of a Board of County Commissioners for the County of Bulloch; to provide that the same will consist of three Commissioners; to prescribe their powers and duties; to fix their compensation and the manner of their selection; and to provide when this Act shall go into effect, and for other purposes.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of same, That there shall be established and created in Bulloch County a Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues in said County, to consist of three members. Persons eligible to hold other county offices shall be eligible to hold the office of Commissioner of Roads and Revenues in said County. Board of three created.

Sec. 2. The three Commissioners for said County shall be selected as follows, to serve in the year 1922: The Grand Jury of said County at the October Term,
1921, shall recommend three members, eligible as herein provided, who shall be appointed immediately by the Judge of Bulloch Superior Court then presiding, and they shall take and hold office from and after January first, 1922, and until January 1st, 1923, it being the intention of this Act that the present County Commissioners shall hold office during the remainder of the year 1921. The successors to said three members selected as herein provided shall be elected at the time and manner of the election of members of the General Assembly for said county at the regular election in November, 1922, and shall hold office for a period of two years and until their successors are elected and qualified. Recommendation and appointment. Term. Election of successors. Term.

Sec. 3. Be it further enacted, That in case of vacancy in said offices of County Commissioners, the Judge of the Superior Court of said County is hereby authorized and empowered to appoint a Commissioner to serve the unexpired term. Vacancies.

Sec. 4. Be it further enacted, That said Board of County Commissioners are to fix their own salary, but shall in no case receive more than the sum of five dollars per day for each day actually engaged in work for the County as a member of said Board, except as hereinafter provided. Maximum salary.

Sec. 5. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That said Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues shall select their own Chairman, and shall also select a Clerk, who shall give all of his time to said work, and shall prescribe the duties of said Clerk and fix his salary; provided, however, said Board may, if it sees fit, select one of their own number as both Chairman and Clerk, and prescribe his duties and fix his salary. Said Chairman shall, upon the order of said Board, draw all warrants and become responsible for all funds
handled by said Board, and said Chairman or said Chairman and Clerk, as the case may be, before entering upon his duties, shall give bond in a responsible surety company in the sum of Twenty Thousand Dollars, payable to and be approved by the Ordinary of said County, conditioned on the faithful performance of his duties as herein prescribed, and the premium on said bond shall be paid from the funds of said County, as allowed by law. Chairman and clerk.

Sec. 6. Be it further enacted, That each Commissioner, before entering upon the duties of his office, shall be required to take the following oath, administered by the Ordinary of said County, to-wit: I will faithfully discharge the duties of Commissioner of Roads and Revenues of Bulloch County in all matters that require my official action, to the best of my knowledge and skill, I will also act, in my judgment, as will be most conducive to the welfare and best interest of the entire county, so help me God, said oath shall by the Ordinary be recorded on the minutes of the Court of Ordinary. Oath of office.

Sec. 7. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That said Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues shall have exclusive and original jurisdiction over the following subject matters, to-wit: Jurisdiction.

item.p: 1st. In directing and controlling all the property of the County, as they may deem expedient, according to law. Property.
2nd. In levying a general tax for general, and a special tax for specific county purposes according to the provisions of law. Tax.
3rd. In establishing, altering and abolishing roads, ferries and bridges, in conformity with law. Roads, etc.
4th. In constructing, building, maintaining and working of the public roads and highways of the County.
5th. In controlling, operating and managing the chaingang of the County. Chain-gang.
6th. In establishing and changing election precincts and militia districts. Precincts and districts.

7th. In supplying by appointment all vacancies in county offices heretofore developing by law upon the Ordinary of said County and Ordinary elections to fill such vacancies. Vacancies in county officers.
8th. In examining and auditing all accounts and legal claims against said county and authorizing the payment of same. Accounts.

9th. In examining and auditing the accounts of all officers having care, management, keeping, collection or disbursement of money belonging to the County or appropriated for its use and benefits and bringing them to a settlement. Accounts of county officers.
10th. In regulating and managing the paupers and disbursing of the pauper funds of the County. Paupers.
11th. In regulating peddling in the county and fixing the cost of license, if any be granted. Peddling.

12th. And the said Commissioners shall have and exercise all power heretofore vested in the Ordinary when sitting for county purposes and to exercise such other powers as are granted by law, or may be indispensable to their jurisdiction over county matters and county finances. Powers of ordinary.

law.p:
Sec. 8. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the said Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues shall meet at the court house in said County on the third Tuesday in each month, beginning in January, 1922, and on such days as the business of
the County may require or when called in session by the Chairman of the Board, or as such Board may determine. Meetings.
Sec. 9. Be it further enacted, That it shall be the duty of said Board of Commissioners to keep a record of all the proceedings of said Board in a book kept for that purpose. Record.
Sec. 10. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That a majority of said Commissioners shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of any business of the Board. Quorum.

Sec. 11. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That said Board shall have full authority to employ such overseers, agents, guards and other employees as they may find necessary for properly carrying on the public work of said County, and shall fix and pay the salaries of such overseers, agents, guards or other employees and pay the same by proper warrants upon the County Treasury. Employees.

Sec. 12. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That said Board shall have full authority and power to assess, levy and collect such per capita taxes for purposes of maintaining the roads and highways of said County as are now provided by law. Road taxes.

Sec. 13. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That said Board of Commissioners shall have the authority to enter into contracts for any public works of the County which may be authorized by law and which, in their judgment, may be for the best interests of the County. Contracts for public works.

Sec. 14. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That said Board shall not enter into any contracts with themselves or with any firm or corporation in which either member of said Board may be interested. Certain contracts forbidden.
Sec. 15. Be it further enacted, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.shorttitle: CATOOSA COMMISSIONERS; CONSTRUCTION OF BRIDGE AUTHORIZED.
law.fulltitle: An Act to authorize the Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues of the County of Catoosa to construct and have constructed, a public road across the State's property, occupied by the right-of-way of the Western Atlantic Railroad, at a point about one mile south of Ringgold, in said Catoosa County, and for other purposes.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, That the Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues of the County of Catoosa, be, and the same are, hereby authorized to establish and construct a public road across that part of the State's property occupied by the right-of-way of the Western Atlantic Railroad at a point about one mile south of Ringgold in said County of Catoosa, the area of land to be taken in and used for such public road crossing being more fully described as follows: Commencing fifty-five (55) yards west of Chickamauga Creek on the Calhoun and Felkner Mill public road, diverging from the old road, and running in a northwesterly direction ninety-two (92) yards, crossing the Western Atlantic Railroad, one hundred and sixty-five (165) feet from the Railroad bridge; thence in a westerly direction one hundred (100) feet to, and intersecting the Dixie Highway. Location of bridge.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to amend an Act to create a Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues for the County of Charlton, State of Georgia, approved August 12th, 1920, and for other purposes.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, That Section 1 of the Act approved August 12, 1920, to create a Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues for the County of Charlton, State of Georgia, be, and the same is, hereby amended by striking from said Section 1 the word three in line five of said section, and inserting in lieu thereof the word five, so that said Section 1 when so amended, shall read as follows, to-wit: Act of 1920 amended.

blockquote.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, That a Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues for the County of Charlton, in said State, is hereby created, to consist of five members, who shall be qualified voters of said county. Five members.

law.p: Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the Act approved August 12, 1920, to create a Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues for the County of Charlton, State of Georgia, be further amended by striking Section 2 thereform, and inserting in lieu thereof the following, to-wit:
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That for the purpose of this Act, the County of Charlton shall be divided into five road districts, as follows: Five road districts.

item.p: The Folkston Militia District shall constitute District No. 1.
The Winoka Militia District and the Uptonville Militia District shall constitute District Number Two.
The Trader's Hill Militia District shall constitute District Number Three.
The Gaineyville Militia District and Toledo Militia District shall constitute District Number Four; and
The Moniac Militia District shall constitute District Number Five.

law.p: And one Commissioner shall be elected for each road district from the territory embraced in such road district.

Sec. 3. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That S. F. Mills, Jr., is hereby named Commissioner for District No. One, and that he shall hold his office for a period of one year from the first day of January, 1922, or until his successor is elected and qualified; That O. M. Prescott is hereby named Commissioner for District Number Two. And that he shall hold his office for a period of two years from January 1st, 1922, or until his successor is elected and qualified. That S. G. Gibson is hereby named Commissioner for District Number Three for a period of two years from January 1st, 1922, or until his successor is elected and qualified. That J. C. Boughur is hereby named Commissioner for District Number Four for a period of two years from January 1st, 1922, or until his successor is elected and qualified: and that J. P. Canady is hereby named Commissioner
for District Number Five for a period of one year from January 1st, 1922 or until his successor is elected and qualified. Personnel of board.

Sec. 4. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That Section 7 of the Act approved August 12th, 1920, to create a Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues for the County of Charlton, State of Georgia, be, and the same is, hereby amended by striking from said Section the words and shall do so whenever the other two members or upon the written request in writing and insert in lieu thereof the words or upon the written request of the other four members, so that said Section Seven, when so amended, shall read as follows: 7 amended.

blockquote.p:
Sec. 7. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That said Board of Commissioners shall hold a regular meeting in each month on the first Monday thereof; the first meeting to be held on the first Monday in January, 1921, at ten o'clock a. m. When the present Commissioners of Roads and Revenues for said County shall turn over to them their office, all records, books and official papers therein; together with all county property, with a full inventory of the same and a full and complete statement showing the financial condition of the County. At this meeting, or as soon thereafter as practicable, the Board of Commissioners shall organize by electing one of its members as Chairman, one as Vice Chairman, and every two years thereafter on the first Monday in January a Chairman and Vice Chairman shall be elected, but any Chairman or Vice Chairman shall hold his office until his successor is elected and nothing herein shall prevent the re-election of any Chairman or Vice Chairman. The Vice Chairman shall in the absence or disqualification of the Chairman, or during the vacancy in office of Chairman, perform and discharge all the duties of the Chairman, and in the event of a vacancy
in the office of Chairman and Vice Chairman, the same shall be filled by the Board at its next regular meeting after such vacancy becomes known. The Chairman shall be the Chief Executive of the Board. He shall see that all orders, resolutions and rules of said Board are faithfully filled and impartially executed and enforced, and that all the officers, employers and agents of said Board faithfully and impartially discharge the duties required of them. He shall have the general supervision of the affairs of the County, acting under orders of the Board, and shall preside at all meetings of the Board. He shall have the power to convene the Board in extra session upon his own motion, or upon the written request of the other four members of the Board, and shall do so whenever the other four members make such request in writing. To be read. Extra session.

law.p: Sec. 5. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the Acts approved August 12th, 1920, to create a Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues for the County of Charlton, State of Georgia, be it further amended by striking therefrom Section Sixteen and inserting in lieu thereof the following, to-wit:

blockquote.p: Sec. 16. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the Chairman and two other members of said Board, or in the absence of the Chairman, the Vice Chairman and two other members of said Board of Commissioners, shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of any business of the Board. Quorum.

law.p:
Sec. 6. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That Section 8 of the Act approved August 12th, 1920, to create a Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues for the County of Charlton, State of Georgia, be and the same is hereby amended by striking from said Section Eight the word sixty in the fourth line thereof, and inserting in lieu thereof the word thirty and
inserting the words except the Chairman and he not more than sixty days in one year. After the word year in the fifth line of Section Eight so that said Section Eight when so amended shall read as follows:

blockquote.p: Sec. 8. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the salaries to be received by the Commissioners shall be Five Dollars per day each, but no Commissioner shall receive pay for more than thirty days in any one year, except the Chairman and he not more than sixty days in any one year, and his pay shall be for actual services rendered. At the first regular monthly meeting of each month each Commissioner shall furnish the Clerk of said Board, a statement of his services for the previous month, and upon approval of the Board he shall be paid therefor from the County Treasury in the same manner as other expenses of the County are paid. Salaries.

law.p: Sec. 7. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the Act approved August 12, 1920, to create a Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues for the County of Charlton, State of Georgia, be further amended by striking therefrom Section Seventeen of this Act, and inserting in lieu thereof the following, to-wit:

blockquote.p:
Sec. 17. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the successors to the Commissioners herein named shall be freeholders and residents of the district for which he shall be elected and shall be elected by the voters of said County qualified to vote for members of the General Assembly, and that said election shall be made on the day of the general election for county officers of said Charlton County, Georgia. That a successor to S. F. Mills, Jr., Commissioner for Road District No. One, and a Commissioner for Road District No. Five be elected at the next general election in 1922, and the successor and Commissioner so elected at such general
election shall take office on January 1st, 1923, and at the general election when a member of the General Assembly for Charlton County, Georgia, shall be elected in the year 1924, successors to the other three members of the Board shall be elected, and their successors shall take office January 1st, 1925. That every two years thereafter in the general election for county officers for Charlton County, successors shall be elected to the Commissioners whose term of office shall expire on the first day of January following such general election. And said successors shall qualify and take office on January first of each year following their election in the general election as aforesaid. The Ordinary of Charlton County, Georgia, shall certify to the Governor of the State of Georgia, the date and fact of the election of any Commissioner elected under the provisions of this Section, who shall become commissioned Commissioner of Roads and Revenues for said Charlton County by the Governor. Successors.

law.p: Sec. 8. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That this Act shall go into effect and become operative on the passage of same and approval of the Governor. Effective on approval.

Sec. 9. Be it further enacted, That all Acts heretofore approved by the General Assembly relating to the Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues for the County of Charlton, Georgia, except such part or parts thereof as may be in conflict with this Act, be, and the same are, hereby continued in operation, confirmed and consolidated with and made a part of this Act. Acts continued in operation.
Sec. 10. Be it further enacted, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act requiring all County Officers of Charlton County, Georgia, who by law are required to give bonds for the faithful performance of their duties, to give surety bonds in approved surety companies doing business in this State; providing for the payment of the premiums on said bonds, and for other purposes.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, That from and after the passage of this Act, all County Officers of Charlton County, Georgia, who, by law, are required to give and execute bonds for the faithful performance of their duties, shall be required to furnish surety bonds in approved surety companies doing business in this State. Bonds required.

Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues in and for Charlton County, Georgia, shall be authorized and required to pay the premiums on all said surety bonds as furnished by the county officers out of the general funds of said county. Payment of premiums.
Sec. 3. Be it further enacted, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.shorttitle: CHARLTON ROAD TAX; ACT OF 1915 REPEALED.
law.fulltitle:
An Act to repeal an Act entitled An Act to require and authorize the Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues of Charlton County to pay the Mayor and City Council of the City of Folkston the ad valorem
read tax collected from property within the corporate limits of said city, and for other purposes approved August 9th, 1915, and published in the Georgia Laws of 1915 on pages 176 and 177, and for other purposes.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, That an Act entitled An Act to require and authorize the Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues of Charlton County to pay the Mayor and City Council of the City of Folkston the ad valorem road tax collected from the property within the corporate limits of said city, and for other purposes approved August 9th, 1915, and published in the Georgia Laws of 1915 on pages 176 and 177, be, and the same is, hereby repealed. Payment to Folkston city officers.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.shorttitle: CHARLTON ROAD TAX; ACT OF 1916 REPEALED.
law.fulltitle: An Act to repeal an Act entitled An Act to require and authorize the Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues of Charlton County to pay the Mayor and Council of Homeland the ad valorem road tax collected from property within the corporate limits of said town, and for other purposes approved August 16th, 1916, and published in the Georgia Laws of 1916 on pages 388 and 389, and for other purposes.
law.p:
Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, That an Act entitled An Act to
require and authorize the Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues of Charlton County to pay the Mayor and Council of Homeland the ad valorem road tax collected from property within the corporate limits of said town and for other purposes approved August 16th, 1916, and published in the Georgia Laws of 1916 on pages 388 and 389, be, and the same is, hereby repealed. Payment to Homeland city officers.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.shorttitle: CHARLTON ROAD TAX; ACT OF 1916 REPEALED.
law.fulltitle: An Act to repeal an Act entitled An Act to require and authorize the Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues of Charlton County to pay the Mayor and City Council of St. George the ad valorem road tax collected from property within the corporate limits of said city, and for other purposes approved August 19th, 1916, and published in the Georgia Laws of 1916 on pages 390 and 391, and for other purposes.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, That an Act entitled An Act to require and authorize the Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues of Charlton County to pay the Mayor and City Council of St. George the ad valorem road tax collected from property within the corporate limits of said city, and for other purposes approved August 19th, 1916, and published in the Georgia Laws of 1916 on pages 390 and 391, be, and the same is, hereby repealed. Payment to St. George city officers.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to amend an Act approved August 18, 1913, under which the Commissioners of Chatham County and ex-officio Judges of said County are authorized to hold their Court bi-monthly at the Court House of said County, by striking out the word bi-monthly in the second section of said Act, and inserting in place of the same the word weekly, and for other purposes.
law.p: Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same;

Section 1. That Section two of an Act approved August 18, 1913, amending an Act to create and organize the Commissioners of Chatham County who shall be ex-officio Judges of said County, and to define their jurisdiction and duties, and for other purposes, be and the same is, hereby amended by striking from said section two the word bi-monthly and inserting in place of the same the word weekly, so that said Section two of said Act when amended shall read as follows: Section 2. Be it further enacted, That Section seven of said Act be amended so that said Commissioners of Chatham County and ex-officio Judges may hold their court weekly at the Court House. Act of 1913 amended. Weekly sessions.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to create and name a special Board of Commissioners in and for the County of Cherokee in the State of Georgia, to be known as The New Court House Commissioners of Cherokee County, and to define their powers, duties and terms; to authorize and empower said Board to call an election or elections for a bond issue to build a Court House in and for said County, to fix the amount of said bond issue, to sell said bonds and use the proceeds to erect and equip the new Court House in and for said County; to cause a new Court House in and for said County to be erected, furnished and equipped; to make all contracts and do all other things necessary therefor; to amend an Act approved August 9th, 1915, creating the office of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues in and for said County, and specially Section 8 thereof, so as to divest and take from the said Commissioners the authority and jurisdiction herein conferred upon this special Board of Commissioners and to that extent to repeal the said Act of August 9th, 1915, and for other purposes.
law.p:
Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, That from and after the passage of this Act a special Board of Commissioners shall be created in and for the County of Cherokee in said State to be known as The New Court House Commissioners of Cherokee County, said Board shall consist of Joe Satterfield, the present Commissioner of Roads and Revenues in and for said County and his successors in office who shall be ex-officio a member of the Board hereby created, and the following citizens of said County, viz: Eugene A. McCandless, Canton District; Homer H.
Hardin, Ballground District; Will D. Lattimer, Woodstock District; Elmer P. Redd, Mullins District; Dr. R. M. Moore, Harbin's District. Should there be a vacancy in said Board for any cause, the surviving members shall fill same by election, except as to the ex-officio member. Should the ex-officio member decline to serve, the other members of the Board shall perform all the duties and exercise all the jurisdiction and powers herein conferred upon special Board of Commissioners. Establishment. Personnel. Vacancies.

Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the object and purpose of the creation of this special Board of Commissioners is the erecting, equipping and furnishing of a new Court House in and for said County by said special Board of Commissioners, and to that end and for that purpose they are given full authority and jurisdiction as provided in Section 387 et seq; of Parks Code of 1914, including the calling an election or elections for a bond issue therefor, the fixing of the amount of such issue, the rate of interest thereon, the sale of bonds, the levying of taxes for the payment of the principal and interest on such bonds, the raising of all moneys necessary to the erection, equipping and furnishing of a new Court House by the sale of bonds, the levying of taxes or otherwise, as may be best, to make all contracts necessary therefor, and to do and perform all acts and exercise all powers and jurisdiction necessary or incident of building, equipping and furnishing of modern up-to-date Court House in and for said County. Establishment of new court house. Authority of commissioners. Bond issue.

Sec. 3. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That an Act of the General Assembly of said State, approved August 9th, 1915, creating the office of Commissioner of Roads and Revenues in and for said County, and especially Section 8 thereof, be amended so as to divest and take from the said Commissioner of Roads and Revenues of said County, all the powers, authorities and jurisdictions herein conferred upon said special Board of Commissioners, and in so far as the provisions
of this Act conflict with said Act of August 9th, 1915, the latter Act is repealed, but in all other respects and as to all other provisions of said Act of August 9th, 1915, it remains intact. Act of 1915 amended. Powers of commissioner of roads and revenues.

Sec. 4. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the Clerk of Commissioner of Roads and Revenues in and for said County, shall be ex-officio Clerk of said special Board of Commissioners of said County, that he shall attend the meetings of said Board and record the proceedings of said Board and all contracts entered in by and in behalf of said Board upon the Minutes of said Commissioner of Roads and Revenues or upon a private book of minutes to be provided by said Board as they may determine. Said Clerk shall receive such compensation for services rendered said Board as they may fix therefor. Should said Clerk fail or refuse to serve said Board in a manner satisfactory to them, they are authorized to dispense with his services, elect a Clerk for said Board and make provision for the record of their proceedings and contracts and the preservation of their files, records and documents. Ex-officio clerk.

Sec. 5. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That said Board shall elect a Treasurer to receive and disburse all funds that may come into the custody of said Board. The Board shall determine what salary if any he shall receive and what bond he shall make and how it shall be approved. The Board shall determine what form of warrant shall be used for the payment of moneys and how the same shall be drawn or counter-signed. The said Treasurer shall not be authorized to pay out any money except upon the warrant so provided and when executed in conformity with the order of said Board. Said Treasurer shall submit statements to said Board as often as the same may be required, showing receipts and disbursements to the date of such statements,
and his books and vouchers shall be subject to examination by said Board or its representatives at all times. Treasurer.

Sec. 6. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the members of said Board shall serve without compensation, but all expenses incurred by them in the performance of their duties under this Act shall be paid out of funds coming into their hands. In the event any election for bonds called by said Board shall fail to receive the necessary number of votes to authorize the issuing of said bonds under the law, said Board is authorized to call other elections for authority to issue bonds at intervals of not less than six months from last previous election. The terms of the members of said Board shall continue until a new Court House in and for said County of Cherokee is fully completed, equipped and furnished and until the said Board has fully discharged and performed all of its duties in connection with or incident thereto, and thereupon the said Board shall be dissolved, its jurisdiction and authority over said Court House shall cease and the same revert to and be under the jurisdiction and control of the Commissioners of Roads and Revenues, as provided by the Act of August 9th, 1915. No compensation. Expenses paid. Bond issues. Terms.
Sec. 7. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict herewith be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.shorttitle: COBB COMMISSIONERS ABOLISHED; OFFICE OF COMMISSIONER CREATED.
law.fulltitle:
An Act to repeal an Act approved August 22, 1907, creating a Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues
for Cobb County, Georgia, and prescribe their duties and powers and for other purposes, and to create in lieu thereof the office of Commissioner of Roads and Revenues for the County of Cobb, Georgia, to consist of one member, to prescribe the duties, qualifications and powers of the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues for Cobb County, Georgia, to fix his salary, provide for his election, to fix and define his term of office and the election of his successor and the filling of any vacancy; to provide for and to create a Bond Commission for Cobb County, Georgia, to consist of twelve members, one of whom shall be the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues of Cobb County, Georgia, who shall be the Chairman of said Bond Commission by virtue of his office as Commissioner of Roads and Revenues for Cobb County, Georgia, to serve with the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues for Cobb County, Georgia, to provide for the membership of said Commission, their term of office, to prescribe their duties and powers and their compensation, to provide for the filling of any vacancy that may occur on said Bond Commission; to provide for the submission of this Act to the people of Cobb County for ratification, that the same shall not become effective until so ratified and for other purposes.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, That an Act approved August 22, 1907, creating a Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues and for other purposes, be and the same is, hereby repealed. Act of 1907 repealed.

Sec. 2. Be it enacted by the authority aforesaid, That from and after the passage of this Act, there is created in and for Cobb County, Georgia, the office of Commissioner of Roads and Revenues to be composed of one Commissioner who shall hold office for the term of four years from January 1, 1922, and who shall be elected by the qualified voters of Cobb County, Georgia,
at an election to be held for that purpose on the 20th day of October, 1921, and there is hereby created to serve with and in conjunction with the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues for the period of time herein set out and for the purposes herein set, a Bond Commission in and for said County to be composed of twelve members consisting of the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues and one member of said Commission to be selected and chosen by the directors of each of the eleven Banking Institutions in the said County of Cobb, to-wit: The First National Bank, Marietta, Ga.; Marietta Trust Banking Co., Marietta, Ga.,; Merchants Farmers Bank, Marietta, Ga.; S. Lemon Banking Co., Acworth, Ga.; Bank of Acworth, Acworth, Ga.; Bank of Powder Springs, Powder Springs, Ga.; Bank of Smyrna, Smyrna, Ga.; Austell Bank, Austell, Ga.; Citizens Bank of Roswell, Roswell, Ga.; Bank of Roswell, Roswell, Ga.; and Kennesaw State Bank, Kennesaw, Ga. One commissioner. Term. Election. Bond commissioner.

Sec. 3. That the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues of Cobb County shall be a member of said Bond Commission and shall be Chairman thereof. The eleven members selected by the authority aforesaid, shall be made by the directors of each of the respective banks and shall be either the President, Vice-President or Cashier of the bank by which said member is chosen. The directors shall certify such selection to the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues of Cobb County, Georgia, under the seal of the corporation making the selection, which certificate shall be recorded upon the minutes or records of the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues of Cobb County, Georgia, and upon the minutes of the said Bond Commission and such certificates shall be evidence of the selection of such member and his authority to act on such Bond Commission after having taken the oath of office. Any vacancy on said Bond Commission from among the members selected by said banks, caused by death or resignation shall be filled by the Board of Directors
of the respective bank in the same manner as herein provided for the first selection. Any vacancy on said Bond Commission or in the office of the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues caused by death or resignation or otherwise of the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues shall be filled at an election to be held by the Ordinary of Cobb County, Georgia, within twenty days after the same shall have occurred. Commissioner chairman of bond commission. Other commissioners. Vacancies.

Sec. 4. Be it enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues elected as hereinafter provided shall be commissioned by the Governor for the term of office for which he is elected before entering upon his discharge of his duties he shall subscribe to the oath required of the County Officers before the Ordinary of Cobb County and shall give bond with good security to be approved by the Ordinary of said County payable to the Governor of the State of Georgia or Ordinary of said County and their successors in office in the just and full sum of Ten Thousand Dollars conditioned for the faithful performance of his duties in office. The premium on said bond shall be paid by Cobb County. Commissioner; oath and bond.

Sec. 5. Be it enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues shall hold a regular court on the 1st Tuesday in each month for the transaction of public business pertaining to county matters, the same to be held in the present room or office in the Court House at Marietta, Georgia, occupied and used by the Commissioners of Roads and Revenues of said County; provided that the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues may hold sessions at any time he may deem proper for the transaction of county matters; and the Commissioner is hereby authorized to administer oaths and hear testimony as to all matters over which he has jurisdiction and when sitting as a court shall have power to punish for contempt under the same rules and regulations as provided for other courts. Monthly court.

Sec. 6. The Commissioner shall keep the minutes of all transactions of the office, fill and keep in order of their date all original orders and papers, petitions, applications and other papers, addressed to the Commissioner concerning county business. The Commissioner shall also keep on record and in a separate book the payment of all money out of the County Treasury or of County Depository by order of the Commissioner, giving the amount and date of said such payments, and the persons to whom paid and for what purpose paid. Said Commissioner shall also keep a book showing a full and detailed statement of all accounts or other indebtedness contracted by the Commissioner. All the books, files and records required to be used or kept in the office of the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues shall always be ready and open to inspection of any tax payer of the county. Minutes and papers. Record of disbursements.

Sec. 7. The said Commissioner shall receive for his compensation to be paid out of the County Treasury, a salary of Three Thousand ($3,000) Dollars per annum for his services, to be paid monthly at the end of each month's services. Salary.

Sec. 8. The said Commissioner shall have exclusive jurisdiction and control over the following matters, towit: In controlling all of the property belonging to said county as he may deem expedient according to law, including the proceeds of the sale of any and all bonds which may have heretofore been authorized or which may hereafter be authorized in said county, except as hereinafter qualified; in allowing the insolvent list of the county; in settling all claims and accounts of officers having the care, management, or disbursement of county funds, in providing for the poor of the county, and for the promotion of health as granted by law or not inconsistent with law; to levy taxes for county purposes; to examine the tax digest of said county; for the correction of errors in regulating or fixing fees, as may be
provided by the law; in maintaining the county chaingang or the public roads or public works of the county, as provided by law, such as superintendents, wardens, guards of convicts and district road overseers; in fixing the amount of commutation tax or the number of days' work to be performed in lieu of said tax, and fixing the per diem of road overseers as said Commissioner of Roads and Revenues may deem best for the interest of the county; in fixing the time when said commutation tax shall be paid or the work performed, in trying road defaulters in accordance with the law; and to have and to exercise all the power heretofore vested in the Ordinary of said County when sitting for county purposes, and to exercise such other powers as are granted by law, or may be indispensable to his jurisdiction over matters and county finances. Jurisdiction.

Sec. 9. That the Treasurer of Cobb County or Depository of said County shall not disburse or pay any funds unless the same shall have been approved and signed by the Commissioner himself; provided this shall not apply to the jury scrip issued by the Clerk of the Superior Court and orders drawn by the Judge of the Superior Court and Solicitor-General and orders issued by the Ordinary in the conduct of county affairs under his jurisdiction. It shall be the duty of the present Board of Commissioners of Roads and Revenues of the said county to deliver to the said Commissioner all books and papers held by them relating to county matters and herein conferred upon said Commissioners. Approval of county expenditures.

Sec. 10. It shall be the duty of the said Commissioner to prepare and submit a report to the grand jury at the Spring (March,) Summer (July,) and Fall (November) terms of the Superior Court of Cobb County, and said report shall show the exact ad valorem taxes collected from each Militia District of said County and the per capita road tax collected in each Militia District; also taxes collected for building and repairing bridges,
and he shall show an itemized statement of all receipts and expenditures and the source from whence received, and from whom received, and to whom paid and for what purpose same was expended and the vouchers therefor and also the number and names of parties to whom paid out. Such reports shall show the number and full individual names of each and every person in each and every separate Militia District, who are subject to road duty in said several Militia Districts in said County, which said report or books shall show who paid by time on the road. Reports to grand jury.

Sec. 11. That it shall be the duty of said Commissioner, immediately after each term of the Superior Court of said County, to have published in the newspaper in which the County advertising is done a full and complete itemized statement of the county finances, same to be paid for out of the county treasury, for advertising. Financial statements.

Sec. 12. Be it enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the twelve Commissioners provided for herein who compose and constitute the Cobb County Bond Commission, shall have no other power or jurisdiction except as herein provided, and before entering upon the discharge of his duties, each of said Bond Commissioners shall take and subscribe the following oath: Bond commission. Powers.

item.p: State of Georgia,
Cobb County.

blockquote.p: I do swear that I will well and faithfully discharge the duties of Bond Commissioner for Cobb County, Ga., during my continuance in office according to law and the provisions of the Act creating and defining the duties of the Cobb County Bond Commission, to the best of my skill, knowledge and ability, without favor or affection to any party, so help me, God. Oath of office.

law.p:
Sec. 13. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the members composing the Bond Commission shall have the right to elect a Secretary from among
their members or outside of their membership, if they should so desire. The Secretary shall keep the minutes of all the meetings of the Bond Commission and record the same in a book to be provided for such purposes. The Treasurer of Cobb County shall be the Treasurer of the Bond Commission and shall receive and have custody of all moneys to be handled by the said Bond Commission, as hereinafter provided and shall disburse the same under the order of said Bond Commission as hereinafter provided. Secretary.

Sec. 14. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That within ten days after this Act becomes effective, said Commission shall hold its first meeting and organize. Meetings shall thereafter be held monthly on a date to be fixed by the Commission; except that meetings may be held at any time upon the call of the Chairman; and the Chairman shall promulgate and call a meeting upon the request of any four or more members of the Commission, giving one day's notice to each member prior to such call meeting. Such members of said Commission shall constitute a quorum for the transaction of any business, and a majority present at any meeting shall decide any question. Meetings. Quorum.

Sec. 15. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That said Bond Commission is empowered to employ a civil engineer and attorney and such other agents and employees as it may deem necessary and proper for the performance of their duties hereunder, and shall fix a compensation of all such employees, including such compensation of its Secretary and its Treasurer as it may deem proper and just, all of such expenses to be disbursed from the funds in the hands of said Bond Commission. Employees.

Sec. 16. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That said Bond Commission is created for the purpose of constructing, building or improving by contract or otherwise any roads or bridges within the County
of Cobb with any and all moneys arising from the sources hereinafter named, and they shall as soon as practicable, lay out and designate a system of roads in and for said county, to be built and repaired with moneys received from the issue of Bonds, State Highway Commission or Federal Aid; they shall award all contracts after due and proper advertisement, which advertisement shall be made in the same way and manner as is now prescribed by statute, governing the letting of contracts by the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues for the construction or improvement of roads and bridges; they shall determine the character of such roads as may be constructed or improved; they shall have authority to accept or reject such work as may be done under their authority before paying for the same. Said Bond Commission is hereby required to make a semi-annual report to the Commissioner of Roads and Revenues of Cobb County of the work accomplished, the contracts let, the money in hand, its expenditures and its plans of operation, and when all the moneys paid over to the said Bond Commission from the sources hereinafter named shall have been expended by said Commission, in carrying out the purposes and effect of this Act, and in building up and improving the public roads and bridges of said County shall have been exhausted, the Cobb County Bond Commission shall be considered to have completed its duties and the provisions of this Act in so far as they relate to the Bond Commission shall cease and terminate. It shall be the duty of the Bond Commission herein provided for to supervise direct and control the expenditures of all moneys arising from the issue of bonds of Cobb County, Ga., during the years, 1922 and 1926, inclusive, for the construction or improvements of public roads, or public bridges in the County of Cobb, and to sell at not less than par and in the manner provided by law, and bonds voted and issued during said years by the said County of Cobb, for the purpose of building and constructing roads and bridges in said County,
and to supervise, direct and control the expenditures of all moneys coming and belonging to Cobb County during the said years from the State Highway Commission or the Federal Aid. The Commission shall in its discretion have authority to sell any such bonds as a whole or in installments as the money may be needed and the work progresses. Roads and bridges. Authority of commission. Supervision of expenditures. Bonds.

Sec. 17. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That said Bond Commission shall with such expert assistance as it may deem necessary, make up and publish the plans and an estimate of the cost of the roads and bridges to be improved, such plans to show the standard adopted by said Commission, the roads and bridges to be improved, and an estimate of the cost. Estimates and plans.

Sec. 18. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That all moneys coming into the hands of the said Bond Commission from the sources hereinbefore set out shall be deposited to the credit of the County Treasurer in the accredited banks of Cobb County in proportion to their capital and investments provided that such banks shall give good and sufficient security therefor, under such terms and conditions as the Bond Commission may require, and provided further that such banks will also pay interest at three per cent. per annum on the daily balances of such funds. All such funds shall be disbursed under order of the Bond Commission by warrant signed by its Chairman and Secretary and all accounts shall be approved at the regular meeting of the Board Commission, a quorum being present. Said Bond Commission shall keep itemized books of accounts, showing all moneys received and expended by them under their direction and authority and their books and records of Cobb County. Deposit of funds. Disbursements.

Sec. 19. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That said Bond Commission shall have exclusive jurisdiction and power over the disbursement of the
moneys coming into its hands from the sources herein named, the letting and making of all contracts for the working, repairing, building and improving of the public roads and bridges as may be designated and selected by them in said county, and to that end said Bond Commission is hereby empowered to acquire all material, make all contracts, hire and contract for all labor and services necessary for the purpose of completing and performing the duties imposed upon them by this Act. A competent engineer shall be engaged in the preparation of the plans and specifications for all work to be done, and any and all contractors who shall be awarded any work or any part of the work contemplated by this Act, shall be required to give good and sufficient bond as provided by law, for the faithful performance of any contract so awarded to them. Powers of bond commission.

Sec. 20. Be it further enacted, that before this Act shall go into effect, It shall be submitted to the qualified voters of Cobb County at an election to be called by Ordinary of Cobb County to be held for the purpose on the 22nd day of September, 1921, and if a majority of the votes cast thereat shall be in favor of this Act then the same shall become the law, but should it fail to receive a majority of the votes cast in said election then it shall not become the law. Election to ratify.
Sec. 21. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to repeal An Act creating a County Depository in and for Coffee County and to provide for the receiving and disbursing of county funds and for the keeping of records as heretofore kept by the County Treasurers of this State, and defining the duties of county commissioners relative thereto, and for other purposes, approved August 19, 1916.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of the same, That from and after the passage of this Act, an Act creating a County Depository in and for Coffee County, and to provide for the receiving and disbursing of county funds and for the keeping of records as heretofore kept by the County Treasurers of this State, and defining the duties of County Commissioners relative thereto, and for other purposes approved August 19, 1916, be, and the same is, hereby repealed. Act of 1916 repealed.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict herewith be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act creating a County Depository in and for Coffee County, and to provide for the receiving and disbursing of county funds and for the keeping of records as heretofore kept by the County Treasurers of this State, and defining the duties and powers of County Commissioners relative thereto, and for other purposes.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of same, That the Commissioners of Roads and Revenues of Coffee County shall by a majority vote taken among themselves, select some duly incorporated bank or banks in said county to act as depository or depositories and disbursing agent or agents and for the public funds of said county. Selection of bank.

Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That each bank or banks that shall be so designated as such depository or depositories or disbursing agent or agents, shall receive no compensation for acting as such, but said commissioners shall, if possible, get such bank or banks to pay said county for the privilege of acting as such depository and disbursing agent. No compensation.

Sec. 3. Be it further enacted by authority aforesaid, That no such bank or banks shall be allowed to act as such depository and disbursing agent until it or they shall have given a bond payable to said commissioners in some surety company to be by them approved, conditioned for the faithful performance of all the duties pertaining to said appointment, in the sum of not less than twenty-five thousand dollars. It shall be within the power of said commissioners to require such bank or banks to strengthen such bond or give a new bond or to increase the amount of such bond at any time, and in default of the same being done to revoke the appointment of such bank or banks as depository and disbursing agent. Bond.
Sec. 4. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That it shall be the duty of each bank or banks acting as such depository and disbursing agent; Duties of bank.

item.p: 1. To pay without delay when in funds, all orders issued by said commissioners, or their authority, according to the date of such orders. Payments.
2. To take a receipt on every order when paid and carefully file and preserve the same. Receipts on orders.

3. To keep a well bound book in which shall be entered all receipts, stating when received, from whom, and on what account and all amounts paid out, stating when paid, to whom and on what account. Record of receipts.

4. To keep a well bound book in which shall be entered a full description of all county orders or other forms of indebtedness, as they are presented, and to record a copy of the order of the county authorities levying county taxes in each year as levied. Record of indebtedness.

5. To render reports to and appear before said commissioners whenever notified, and to appear before any grand jury of said county on request, to render an account of its actings and doings as such depository and disbursing agent, and to exhibit its books and vouchers as such depository and disbursing agent whenever notified to do so by said grand jury. Reports.

law.p: Sec. 5. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That said commissioners shall have the power and authority from time to time to prescribe other reasonable duties and regulations for the government of said depositories and disbursing agents, and said depositories and disbursing agents shall be just as much bound to observe the same as they shall be bound to observe those specially provided for in this Act. Other regulations by commissioners.

Sec. 6. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That in the event said commissioners shall be unable to make satisfactory arrangement with any bank in said county to become such depository and disbursing agent, or in the event that it should become to pass that there should be no incorporated bank in said county, then said commissioners shall have the power and authority to appoint some bank in an adjoining county, or in some county in the same section of the State to act as such depository and disbursing agent. Lack of satisfactory bank.

Sec. 7. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That the appointment of such depository and disbursing agent shall be made by the county commissioners of said county at their first meeting after the passage of this Act and shall be for a term of two years from January the first, 1921, and thereafter said county commissioners shall at their first meeting in January biennially make appointment of some bank or banks to act as depository and disbursing agent under the terms of this Act, which appointment shall be for two years and until the successor or such depository and disbursing agent is appointed and qualified. Term.

Sec. 8. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That said commissioners shall, out of the funds of said county, pay for all books and blanks required and necessary to be kept by such depository and disbursing agent of their Acts and doings as such depository and disbursing agent and as well as all premiums on the bond given by said bank under the terms of this Act. Payment for books and blanks.

Sec. 9. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That such depository and disbursing agent shall, at least once in every three months, submit to said commissioners an itemized and detailed statement of all receipts and disbursements of the funds of said county, which statements shall be duly verified by the oath of its cashier. Financial statements.

Sec. 10. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That said commissioners shall, at least once each year, cause the books of said depository, so far the same pertains to its actings and doings as such depository, to be audited by a competent accountant or accountants to be selected and employed by such commissioners for such purposes. Audits.
Sec. 11. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with any provision of this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.shorttitle: COFFEE COUNTY; EXECUTIVE COMMITTEES OF POLITICAL PARTIES.
law.fulltitle: An Act to repeal an Act to provide for the election by the qualified voters of Coffee County of the executive committee of all political parties holding primary elections in said county, and defining the powers and duties of said committee; for abolishing all present executive committees of political parties in said county, and for other purposes, approved August 16, 1917.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by the authority of same, That an Act entitled an Act to provide for the election by the qualified voters of Coffee County of the executive committee of all political parties holding primary elections in said county, defining the powers and duties of said committee; for abolishing all present executive committees of political parties in said county and for other purposes, approved August 16, 1917, Acts 1917, pages 338-41, be and the same is, hereby repealed. Act of 1917 repealed. Election by voters.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to repeal an Act creating a Board of Commissioners of Colquitt County, approved August 21, 1921 and the Act amendatory thereof approved August 19, 1912.
law.p: Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of same, That an Act creating a Board of Commissioners of Colquitt County approved August 21st, 1911, together with an Act amendatory thereof approved August 19th, 1912, is hereby repealed. Acts of 1911 and 1912 repealed.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted by the authority aforesaid, That all laws and parts of laws in conflict with this Act be, and the same are, hereby repealed.

law.fulltitle: An Act to create a Board of Commissioners of Colquitt County; to provide for their election; to prescribe their salary, bond, duties and powers; to provide for the election of a Chairman by the said Board; to define their term of office; to make regulations in reference to the transaction of the business of the Board of Commissioners and for other purposes.
law.p:
Section 1. Be it enacted by the General Assembly of Georgia, and it is hereby enacted by authority of the same, that there is hereby created a Board of Commissioners for Colquitt County who, together with their successors
in office, shall have full jurisdiction and control over all county matters in said county of whatever nature except such matters that have by general law been conferred to some other officer and all powers and duties heretofore exercised by the Board of Commissioners of said County, shall be exercised by the Board herein provided for. Establishment.
Sec. 2. Be it further enacted, That the County of Colquitt be divided into five Commissioner Districts as follows Commissioner districts.

item.p: First Commissioner District to be composed of the territory embraced in Moultrie militia district.
Second Commissioner District to be composed of the territory embraced in Funston, Bridge Creek, Hartsfield and Hamilton militia districts.
Third Commissioner District to be composed of the territory embraced in Mill Creek, Thigpen, Doerun and Monk militia districts.
Fourth Commissioner District to be composed of the territory embraced in Lee, Robinson, Autreyville, and Murphy militia districts.
